title: Hundreds of different dinosaur footprints discovered in UK’s Oxfordshire - Daily Excelsior
NASA's Parker Solar Probe beams home 1st detailed update after record-breaking approach to the sun - Space.com
summary:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe Sends First Detailed Update After Record Sun Approach

Publication Date: January 2, 2025

Source: Space.com

The Parker Solar Probe has successfully transmitted its first telemetry data confirming that it is healthy and operating normally after its closest approach to the sun, which occurred on December 24, 2024.

  • The Parker Solar Probe flew within 3.8 million miles of the sun's surface, the closest any spacecraft has ever approached.
  • Telemetry data indicates that all systems are functional and that scientific instruments operated during the flyby.
  • NASA plans to receive further science data from the probe later this month.
  • The spacecraft traveled at a maximum speed of 430,000 miles per hour.
  • Data from the mission is expected to provide insights into solar phenomena, including the corona's heating mysteries.
"The data is so important for the science community because it gives us another vantage point," - Kelly Korreck, NASA Helio physicist.

This successful flyby marks a significant achievement in space exploration with implications for understanding solar behavior and its effects on the solar system.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Sends First Detailed Update After Record Sun Approach

title: The Thousand Brains Project: A New Paradigm in AI that is Challenging Deep Learning with Inspiration from Human Brain - MarkTechPost
summary:
The Thousand Brains Project: A New Paradigm in AI that is Challenging Deep Learning with Inspiration from Human Brain

Date: October 2024 | Source: MarkTechPost

This article discusses the ambitious Thousand Brains Project, which aims to create a new form of AI inspired by the workings of the human brain, specifically targeting sensorimotor learning.

  • The Thousand Brains Project is a research initiative by Numenta Inc. aimed at developing flexible AI and robotics solutions.
  • It uses sensorimotor learning, enabling machines to learn through interaction and observation.
  • Key components of the project include sensor modules, learning modules, and a motor system connected by a common communication protocol.
  • The first implementation of the project, called Monty, focuses on object recognition and pose detection.
  • The project has potential future applications in language modeling, unsupervised learning, and generalization.
“The Thousand Brains Project is developing a new field of Artificial Intelligence inspired by human brains.”

In conclusion, the Thousand Brains Project aims to build a holistic AI framework that extends beyond current capabilities, promising numerous future applications in AI and robotics.
newTitle: The Thousand Brains Project: A New Paradigm in AI that is Challenging Deep Learning with Inspiration from Human Brain

title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch - India Today
summary:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch

Published On: Jan 3, 2025

Source: indiastodayglobal

The Quadrantid meteor shower will peak on January 3, 2025, offering the first major celestial event of the year with a potential display of up to 200 meteors per hour in optimal conditions.

  • The meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • Best viewing time is in the early morning hours before dawn on January 3.
  • Ideal viewing conditions include dark, clear skies away from city lights, particularly in the Northern Hemisphere.
  • NASA emphasizes the importance of allowing your eyes to adjust to darkness for the best experience.
“The sight of these large, colourful explosions of light will be a stunning way to start your year.”

Don't miss the chance to observe this beautiful astronomical event, ensuring you have the best conditions to enjoy the stunning display of meteors.
newTitle: Quadrantid Meteor Shower: First 'shooting stars' of 2025 – when and where to watch

title: Elon Musk is standing in the way as Jeff Bezos reaches for orbit - Financial Times
summary:
Elon Musk is standing in the way as Jeff Bezos reaches for orbit

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Financial Times

Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin is on the cusp of its first orbital rocket launch, potentially creating competition with Elon Musk’s SpaceX. However, this new phase of the rocket business presents challenges for Bezos as Musk has gained political influence that could affect regulations and contracts.

  • Blue Origin has suffered significant delays and aims to enter a competitive orbit market.
  • Musk's influence in Washington may hinder Bezos’s ambitions and lead to a monopolistic situation for SpaceX.
  • Economics of space travel are shifting in favor of established players like SpaceX.
  • The demand for space launches is expected to outpace supply due to increasing military and commercial needs.
“The demand for space launches is expected to far exceed supply for the rest of this decade.”

Despite the hurdles, Bezos’s Blue Origin still has a market to capture, especially with military contracts in high demand.
newTitle: Elon Musk Hinders Jeff Bezos's Orbit Aspirations

title: Stunning Jurassic highway: Hundreds of dinosaur footprints unearthed in Oxfordshire quarry - The Economic Times
Jurassic Park in real life? Hundreds of dinosaur footprints unearthed in UK's Oxfordshire | Today News - Mint
summary:
Jurassic Park in Real Life? Hundreds of Dinosaur Footprints Unearthed in UK’s Oxfordshire

Date: January 2, 2025
Source: Live Mint

In an astonishing revelation that feels straight out of a Jurassic Park film, researchers have unearthed hundreds of dinosaur footprints in a quarry in Oxfordshire, southern England. Dating back approximately 166 million years, these footprints provide a fascinating glimpse into the prehistoric world of giant reptiles.

  • The discovery was made at Dewars Farm Quarry by palaeontologists from the Universities of Oxford and Birmingham.
  • Five extensive trackways were found, with one stretching over 150 metres.
  • Four trackways belong to colossal sauropods, likely Cetiosaurus, which could reach lengths of up to 18 metres.
  • The fifth trackway belonged to the carnivore Megalosaurus, identifiable by its three-toed prints.
  • The interaction between different dinosaur species raises intriguing questions for researchers.
“Scientists have been studying Megalosaurus for longer than any other dinosaur on Earth, and yet these recent findings prove there is still new evidence waiting to be uncovered.” - Emma Nicholls

The footprints were discovered by quarry worker Gary Johnson, leading to a week-long excavation that revealed around 200 footprints. This find enhances our understanding of dinosaur behaviors and interactions, indicating ongoing excitement in palaeontological research in the UK.
newTitle: Jurassic Park in Real Life? Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in Oxfordshire

title: Multiscale Force Sensing with Photon-Avalanching Nanocrystals - AZoNano
summary:
Multiscale Force Sensing with Photon-Avalanching Nanocrystals

Publication Date: 2025, Source: Nature

Researchers from Columbia Engineering have developed advanced nanoscale force sensors that utilize luminescent nanocrystals, enabling remote measurements of mechanical forces with high sensitivity and a wide dynamic range.

  • The new sensors are significantly more sensitive, offering up to 100 times better force sensitivity than existing technologies.
  • They can operate in previously inaccessible environments, allowing continuous monitoring from subcellular to whole-system levels.
  • The sensors utilize the photon-avalanching effect to enhance their optical response and sensitivity.

We expect our discovery will revolutionize the sensitivities and dynamic range achievable with optical force sensors, and will immediately disrupt technologies in areas from robotics to cellular biophysics and medicine to space travel.

— Jim Schuck, Associate Professor, Columbia Engineering

The advancement in these sensors represents a significant leap in the capability to measure forces in diverse fields such as robotics, medicine, and environmental monitoring.
newTitle: Advancements in Nanoscale Force Sensors Using Photon-Avalanching Technology

title: MIT scientists pin down the origins of a fast radio burst - WebWire
summary:
MIT Scientists Identify Origins of Fast Radio Bursts

Date Published: Thursday, January 2, 2025 | Source: WEBWIRE

MIT astronomers have pinpointed the origins of a fast radio burst, FRB 20221022A, detected from a galaxy 200 million light-years away, suggesting it emerged from the magnetosphere of a neutron star.

  • The research reveals that fast radio bursts (FRBs) are brief explosions of radio waves likely caused by neutron stars or black holes.
  • The study, published in Nature, uses a novel technique to analyze the scintillation of FRB 20221022A.
  • The findings imply that FRBs can originate from highly chaotic and magnetic environments around compact objects.
  • The researchers estimate that FRB 20221022A erupted from within 10,000 kilometers of its source.
“The exciting thing here is, we find that the energy stored in those magnetic fields, close to the source, is twisting and reconfiguring such that it can be released as radio waves that we can see halfway across the universe.” - Kiyoshi Masui, MIT Associate Professor of Physics

This study enhances our understanding of fast radio bursts and their origins, paving the way for future research in astrophysics.
newTitle: MIT Scientists Identify Origins of Fast Radio Bursts

title: From meteor shower to comet: Astronomical events to look forward to in Jan 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
Astronomical Events to Look Forward to in January 2025

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: Unknown

January 2025 brings a dazzling lineup of astronomical events that will captivate both avid sky-watchers and casual stargazers.

  • January 3: Venus and Moon conjunction visible after sunset.
  • January 3-4: Quadrantid Meteor Shower peaks with 60 to 200 meteors per hour.
  • January 4: Occultation of Saturn by the Moon observable in select locations.

  • January 9-10: Venus reaches its greatest elongation.

  • January 29: New Moon, ideal for stargazing.

In summary, this January offers numerous celestial events that provide excellent opportunities for stargazing and appreciating the wonders of our universe.

title: Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist - The Hindu
summary:
Theory of relativity, quantum physics key to explaining Big Bang, says scientist

Published: January 02, 2025, Source: The Hindu

A combination of Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity and quantum physics may help explain the expansion of the universe from a singular entity, according to P. Ajith, an astrophysicist with the International Centre for Theoretical Sciences in Bengaluru. He presented this topic during a lecture at the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium in Kozhikode.

  • The primordial atom theory, proposed by Georges Lemaitre, is more of a narrative than a scientific fact.
  • History of cosmic understanding spans from Copernicus to Newton, shaping modern science and technology.
  • Einstein’s theory redefined gravity as a consequence of space-time effects rather than a force.
“The primordial atom is just a way of explaining what might have happened. To understand what happened then, we need to combine Einstein’s theory of relativity with quantum physics.” - P. Ajith

The integration of these scientific principles might offer profound insights into the universe's origins and evolution, highlighting the importance of continued exploration in physics.
newTitle: Key Insights on Big Bang Explained Through Relativity and Quantum Physics

title: Unveiling Galactic Diversity with the Dark Energy Camera - AZoQuantum
summary:
Unveiling Galactic Diversity with the Dark Energy Camera

Date: January 2023 | Source: NSF NOIRLab

This article showcases an impressive image of the Antlia Cluster taken by the Dark Energy Camera (DECam), revealing the rich diversity of galaxy types in this region of space.

  • DECam captures a portion of the 230 galaxies in the Antlia Cluster.
  • The image reveals a variety of galaxy types, including lenticular, irregular, and ultra-compact dwarfs.
  • Two massive elliptical galaxies, NGC 3268 and NGC 3258, dominate the cluster.
  • The study of the Antlia Cluster has contributed to understanding dark matter and galaxy evolution.
  • Future surveys, such as the Legacy Survey of Space and Time (LSST), are expected to provide more insights into galaxy distribution and dark matter.
"Large and sensitive instruments like DECam have allowed astronomers to explore subtler features of galaxy clusters."

This article highlights the advancements in astronomical technology and the importance of continued studies in understanding our universe.
newTitle: Exploring the Diversity of Galaxies in the Antlia Cluster

This article highlights six breathtaking images of quasars and black holes captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the beauty and complexity of these astronomical phenomena.

  • Markarian 231: Two black holes in a close orbital dance illuminating the galaxy’s center.
  • Markarian 817: A spiral galaxy with blue star clusters surrounding an active supermassive black hole.
  • Quasar 3C 273: One of the closest quasars, its light took 2.5 billion years to reach Earth.
  • NGC 4438: A black hole exhibiting chaotic behavior with massive outflows of hot gas.
  • Quasar Tsunamis: Showcases the immense energy produced by quasars.
"Quasars produce immense energy, powered by a supermassive black hole consuming surrounding matter."

This collection of images not only illustrates the stunning visuals provided by the Hubble Space Telescope but also emphasizes the crucial role that these celestial bodies play in the universe.

This January, stargazers and astronomers will witness a spectacular alignment of four major planets: Mars, Venus, Saturn, and Jupiter, with the best view on January 17 and 18.

  • Mars will reach its brightest point on January 15-16, sitting prominently in the constellation Gemini.
  • Venus and Saturn will appear unusually close together, separated by only a few finger widths.

  • Uranus and Neptune will also be visible for those with telescopes.

summary:
Shooting Stars Explained: More Than Just a Nighttime Wonder

Publication Date: December 16, 2024    Source: Hindustan Times

Meteors, often referred to as shooting stars, are dazzling lights that zip across the night sky.

  • There are three main types of meteorites: irons, stonys, and stony-irons.
  • More than 50,000 meteorites have been discovered on Earth.
  • Most meteorites found are from shattered asteroids, with a few from Mars and the Moon.
“By studying meteorites we can learn more about our solar system’s history.”

This exploration into meteors reveals their significance in understanding the origins of our solar system.

title: Watching a Solar Event from All Angles - Eos
summary:
Watching a Solar Event from All Angles

Publication Date: 2 January 2025

Source: Eos

In spring 2024, a widespread atmospheric light show captivated observers globally as aurorae danced across the night sky, resulting from chaotic solar explosions earlier. The event highlighted that for the first time, a fleet of solar probes was observing the Sun's activity, significantly enhancing the understanding of solar events and their impacts on Earth.

  • The solar explosions triggered auroras seen from Florida to New Zealand.
  • These events stemmed from a powerful active region on the Sun that was monitored by the newly launched Solar Orbiter.
  • Research presented at the AGU’s Annual Meeting 2024 underscored the importance of continuous solar observation.
  • Solar flares and coronal mass ejections from the Sun can significantly affect Earth’s magnetic field and technology.
  • The Solar Orbiter allows simultaneous monitoring of solar events from multiple angles, improving understanding of solar phenomena.
“It’s enabling us to do this type of research that was not available 5 or 6 years ago.”

“I guess we can say we dodged the biggest bullet,” noted George Ho, reflecting on recent solar activity.

This research sheds light on the need for ongoing solar observation as stronger solar events could impact Earth’s technology and safety in the future.
newTitle: Watching a Solar Event from All Angles

title: In 5 pictures how Saturn is a mini solar system in itself - India Today
summary:
In 5 pictures how Saturn is a mini solar system in itself

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: India Today

This article explores Saturn's fascinating features through five captivating images, highlighting its moons, rings, and their overall dynamics.

  • Saturn has 146 known moons, with Titan being the largest.
  • The planet's iconic rings consist of ice and rock particles, forming distinct bands.
  • Strong gravitational pull governs the orbits of its moons and ring particles.
  • Moons like Enceladus and Titan are geologically active, with geysers and atmospheres.
  • Saturn's moons exhibit diverse orbital patterns, highlighting their unique dynamics.
"Saturn's moons interact with the planet's rings, forming intricate subsystems akin to planetary systems."

The fascinating features of Saturn and its moons present them as a mini solar system, highlighting their unique geological and orbital dynamics.
newTitle: Saturn: A Mini Solar System Captured in 5 Pictures

title: 2025's first meteor shower 'Quadrantid' to light up the skies: How to watch in India? - DNA India
summary:
2025's first meteor shower 'Quadrantid' to light up the skies: How to watch in India?

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: DNA India

The Quadrantid meteor shower, one of the most exciting astronomical events of 2025, will light up the night sky on 3 and 4 January. Active since 27 December, it promises a spectacular start to the New Year with meteors visible across the sky.

  • The Quadrantids have a brief peak, lasting only a few hours.
  • During the peak, you could see between 60 to 200 meteors per hour, depending on weather conditions, according to NASA.
  • This meteor shower originates from the asteroid 2003 EH1.
  • The best viewing times in India will be during the early hours of January 3 and 4.
  • Expected rates of meteors during the peak are between 80 to 120 per hour.
“To make the experience even better, the planetarium will set up telescopes for public viewing.” - Sumit Srivastava, senior scientific officer at the Indira Gandhi Planetarium

This meteor shower is a thrilling way to start 2025, offering a beautiful display for night sky watchers in India.
newTitle: How to Watch the Quadrantid Meteor Shower in India on January 3-4, 2025

title: NASA warns two aeroplane-sized asteroids approaching Earth today. Check timings and key details - The Economic Times
summary:
NASA Warns of Two Aeroplane-Sized Asteroids Approaching Earth

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Times of India

NASA has issued a warning about two asteroids, 2024 YF7 and 2024 YR9, approaching Earth, indicating that while there is no immediate threat, the need to monitor such celestial events is growing.

  • Asteriod 2024 YF7 is 78 feet in diameter and will have its closest approach at 2:53 a.m. on January 2.
  • It will travel at a speed of 30,367 miles per hour and will pass 2,080,000 miles from Earth.
  • Asteriod 2024 YR9 is slightly smaller at 76 feet in diameter and will travel faster at 46,338 miles per hour.
  • Both asteroids will safely pass Earth without posing a threat.
"These ancient rocks, dating back 4.6 billion years, carry vital information about the solar system’s past."

NASA utilizes advanced technology for tracking near-Earth asteroids, with efforts aimed at improving planetary defense and expanding our understanding of potential threats.

This monitoring is critical in ensuring preparedness for future challenges in space exploration and safety.
newTitle: NASA Warns of Two Aeroplane-Sized Asteroids Approaching Earth

title: AI cracks 2,000-year-old mysteries: Ancient texts revealed for the first time - News9 LIVE
summary:
AI Cracks 2,000-Year-Old Mysteries: Ancient Texts Revealed for the First Time

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: Science News

Artificial intelligence is transforming archaeology by revealing ancient texts long thought to be lost. Researchers are utilizing modern neural networks to decode charred scrolls and inscriptions, reshaping our understanding of history.

  • AI is used to decipher ancient texts, including those damaged by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.
  • The Vesuvius Challenge applies AI to decipher the Herculaneum papyri, previously unreadable due to their fragile state.
  • AI aids in uncovering significant historical insights that have been hidden for centuries.
  • The use of neural networks in different contexts including Oracle Bone Script and ancient Greek inscriptions enhances text recovery.
  • Teams are virtually unwrapping Herculaneum scrolls through high-resolution CT scans to reveal their contents.
AI's skill in translating remote languages and scripts opens new avenues for historical revelations, potentially reshaping our understanding of early civilizations.

This innovative application of AI in archaeology heralds a new era of historical discovery, offering hope that many lost works can now be understood and appreciated.
newTitle: AI Cracks Ancient Texts: Revolutionizing Archaeology and History

title: 2025’s first meteor shower: Head outside Mumbai to see the Quadrantids on January 3, 4 - mid-day.com
Transforming the Moon Into Humanity’s First Space Hub - WIRED
summary:
Transforming the Moon Into Humanity’s First Space Hub

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Wired

This year marks a turning point in humanity’s relationship with the moon, as we begin to lay the foundations for a permanent presence on its surface, paving the way for our natural satellite to become an industrial hub.

  • Three critical elements for developing a lunar economy: access, refueling capabilities, and profitable enterprises.
  • SpaceX's Starship, designed for reuse and capable of delivering significant payloads to the moon, will demonstrate its capabilities in 2025.
  • Blue Origin’s Blue Moon lander will mark its maiden flight in 2025, crucial for establishing lunar infrastructure.
  • Nasa’s Artemis II mission intends to carry a crew around the moon in late 2025, a significant step towards lunar exploration.
  • The Lunar Gateway will be launched in 2025, acting as a logistics hub for lunar missions.
  • Starpath is developing a lunar gas station to support sustainable fuel production for return journeys to Earth.
“As these technologies take off, the moon will no longer be just a distant, desolate place. It will become the gateway to humanity’s future in space.”

This initiative paints an optimistic picture of the moon’s potential, transforming it into a stepping stone for future space exploration.
newTitle: Transforming the Moon Into Humanity’s First Space Hub

title: Space-Comm Expo reveals 2025 space industry trends and challenges - BroadcastProME.com
First meteor shower of 2025 is coming. How to catch the Quadrantids - India Today
summary:
First Meteor Shower of 2025: How to Catch the Quadrantids

Published On: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: India Today

As the new year unfolds, stargazers are in for a treat with the Quadrantid meteor shower, which peaks on January 3-4, 2025. This celestial event marks the first significant meteor shower of the year, offering a dazzling display of fireballs streaking across the night sky.

  • The Quadrantids are a unique meteor shower, originating from the asteroid 2003 EH1.
  • They peak at 60 to 120 meteors per hour under ideal conditions.
  • The meteor shower is visible particularly between 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM local time.
  • Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails but can be bright fireballs.
  • The meteor shower will remain active until January 16, 2025.
Nasa's William Cooke notes that while Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails, their heads can appear as bright fireballs.

Finding a dark location away from city lights is essential for optimal viewing. Minimal moonlight interference offers an excellent opportunity for celestial enthusiasts to enjoy this spectacular event.
newTitle: First Meteor Shower of 2025: How to Catch the Quadrantids
